long_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/applab-intro/s: **Goal:** Make the screen green. **How:** Drag in a `setProperty()` block. Use the dropdowns to set the screen's `"background-color"` to `"green"`. Then hit "Run". **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]
**Goal:** Make the text bigger and blue. **How:** You'll need two lines of code. Give `"label1"` a `"font-size"` of `80` and `"text-color"` of `"blue"`. **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]

**Goal:** Make the buttons `"red"` and `"blue"`. Then change the text in the large orange label. **How:** - Remember you can hover over elements to see their `"id"`. - Set the `"background-color"` of the buttons to `"red"` and `"blue"`. - Set the `"text"` property of the label to anything you want, like `"Welcome to my app!"`. **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]

**Goal:** The screen will start out blue. Add code so it turns green when you click the "Green-ify" button. **How:** Add code inside the `onEvent()` that sets the screen's `"background-color"` to `"green"`. **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]

**Goal:** Help finish this flashlight app. The "On" button already turns the screen white. Run the app and try it out. Then write code so the "Off" button makes the screen black again. **How:** Add code inside the empty `onEvent()` that sets the `"background-color"` of the screen to `"black"` and `"text-color"` of the label to `"white"`. **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]

**Goal:** This sound board is almost done! Run it to see how it works. Then add an image, text, and sound to the last button. **How:** - Add an `onEvent()` to the program and set the "id" to `"button4"`. Drag a `playSound()` into the `onEvent()` and choose a sound from the library. - Add a `setProperty()` (outside your `onEvent()`) to change the button's `"image"` property. Choose an image using the third dropdown. - Add one more `setProperty()` to change the button's `"text"`. **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]

**Goal:** Add a second button to the screen that says "Right!" with an `"id"` of `"rightButton"`. **How:** In Design Mode drag in a new button. Position and resize it. Then set its `"id"`, `"text"`, `"background color"`, and `"font size"`. **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]

**Goal:** Create a new screen called `"rightScreen"`. Add a text label that says "You went right!". **How:** In Design Mode drag in a new screen element. Change its `"id"` to `"rightScreen"`. Then drag a label onto the screen and change the text to "You went right!". **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]

**Goal:** The screen switches to `"rightScreen"` when the user clicks the `"rightButton"`. **How:** In Code Mode add a new `onEvent()` to your program for your "Right!" button. Add a `setScreen()` block inside of it that switches screens to `"rightScreen"`. **Stuck? Click here:** [expandable][0]

**Goal:** Build your own app by extending this project. Then "Share" it with someone! **How:** Decide what type of app you're interested in building. Then go build it by adding more screens, buttons, text, sound, and user interactions to your app. There's a few more blocks in the toolbox that you can experiment with as well. Once you're done click "Share" to send it to yourself or a friend!
Choose Your Own Adventure Ideas Try out this Example Choose Your Own Adventure App so you can see how one works. Here's some ideas to help you come up with your own story.
  • Make an adventure about your favorite character, real or fictional.
  • Make an adventure that tells the story of your favorite book, movie, or your own creation.
  • Make an adventure that has a lot of unexpected twists or has a difficult moral choice.

    • Greeting Card Ideas Try out this Example Greeting Card App so you can see how one works. Here's some ideas to help you come up with your own card.
  • Think of a birthday, holiday, or other special day that's coming up. Make a card to celebrate!
  • Create a thank you card for someone you appreciate.
  • Create an invitation for an upcoming event.

    • Personality Quiz Ideas Try out this Example Personality Quiz App so you can see how one works. Here's some ideas to help you come up with your own quiz.
  • Make a quiz that suggests something a person might like, for example a meal, a team, a book, or a place.
  • Make an quiz that "predicts the future" based on their answers.
  • Make a quiz to help people make a hard decision.

https://studio.code.org/s/applab-intro/s.applab_hoc_finish: Did the screen turn green? If so, hit 'Finish'. If not, hit 'Reset', change your code, and hit 'Run' again.
